channel.title: RSS feed for tag giton Raymii.org
channel.description: RSS feed for tag giton Raymii.org

item.title: Shared Git repository over ssh for multiple users
item.description: This tutorial will show you how to set up a shared git repo with multiple accounts over ssh. Only ssh, not gitolite or any other software. This is usefull if you have a small team of people that don't often need access to the repo and don't want something like github or bitbucket. With this you can use existing infrastructure.

item.title: Gitlab Active Directory LDAP Authentication
item.description: Gitlab is a self hosted git based source control application similar to Github, written in Ruby on Rails. It is used by many organisations and is a wonderfull piece of software. It supports LDAP Authentication (via the OmniAuth Gem), but it is tricky to set up with Active Directory and Windows Server 2003/2008/2012. This tutorials shows you how to set up Gitlab to authenticate against Active Directory LDAP.

item.title: NGINX: Hide / Block .git and .svn folders
item.description: This little nginx config snippets helps you prohibit access to .git or .svn folders in nginx

item.title: Git-clean
item.description: git-clean - bash script to find big (binary) files in a git repo and history, and clean them

item.title: Ray-Mon - PHP and Bash server status monitoring
item.description: Ray-Mon is a linux server monitoring script written in PHP and Bash, utilizing JSON as data storage. It requires only bash and a webserver on the client side, and only php on the server side. The client currently supports monitoring processes, uptime, updates, amount of users logged in, disk usage, RAM usage and network traffic.

item.title: Bash - do something in every subdirectory
item.description: Snippet which has a copy paste bash for loop to do something in a directory.
